document.heading: Blanket Authority for Limited Waiver of Immunity for the Lease of Property for Tribal Uses
document.text: A Resolution to approve and authorize the Chief or his designee to execute a limited waiver of sovereign immunity in relation to certain lease agreements for the lease of property for Tribal uses, effective for two (2) years.
At a duly called General Meeting of the Upper Mattaponi Tribal Council held this 27th day of September, 2025, the following Resolution and Law were adopted.

recital.text: the Upper Mattaponi Tribe (the "Tribe") is an Indian Tribe that has existed from time immemorial and is federally recognized on a government-to-government basis by the United States of America; and

the Tribe has the authority, pursuant to the limitations of its laws and Constitution of the Upper Mattaponi Tribe (the "Constitution"), to enter into contractual agreements, to buy, sell, and lease land, and among other things, to waive its sovereign immunity for purposes thereof; and
through its leadership, the Tribe wishes from time to time to lease property from Tribal uses; and
the leadership of the Tribe has determined that leasing property for Tribal uses provides a substantial benefit or advantage to the Tribe, as it aligns with the Tribe's goals; and

entering into Lease Agreements for property requires the execution the Contract and various agreements, certifications, statements, affidavits, and other similar documents, which may be necessary and convenient; and
the lease of property often requires a limited waiver of sovereign immunity and the applicability of the laws of other jurisdictions to consummate the Agreements; and

the Constitution provides, "Only the Council and Chief may authorize a waiver of Sovereign Immunity by law enacted in accordance with the Legislative Process. Any authorization by the Council to waive Sovereign Immunity shall be specific, for a limited scope and duration, and in writing." See, Constitution, Article XIII, Section 1.
that the Council hereby authorizes the Chief for two (2) years from the date of this resolution to a Tribal Waiver of Immunity and Consent (the "Waiver"), subject to the following limitations:

para.text: The term of the Lease Agreement does not exceed ten (10) years; and
The rental rate of the Lease is consistent with the prevailing rental rate of a similarly situated property;
The Waiver's duration is limited to the duration of the Lease Agreement; and

The Waiver applies solely to any suit, action, or proceeding arising out of or brought to enforce the Tribe's obligations under the Lease Agreement provided such suit only occurs in a suitable in State court for Virginia; and
This Waiver shall apply only to any suit, action, or proceeding in State court; and
This Waiver is to be construed in accordance with federal law, and proceedings brought pursuant to this waiver shall be governed by laws as set forth in the Contract.

procedural-data.text: The foregoing Resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on the 27th day of September, 2025, at a General Meeting with a vote of 7 in favor and 0 opposed, 0 abstaining, and 0 absent, pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Constitution of the Tribe.
